climbs.name: Turkey Baster
climbs.fa: Tom Kohlman Eric Zschiesche 1991 Ground Up

content.description: Start up the short ramp until you are under the small bulge. Pull the bulge and gain the dyke feature that will take you to the top. Again, cool climb if it were taller and had more traffic it would get a star or two.

This route is to the right of Nuts To You (5.10). Start up the mossy slab to a short bulge. Move up and follow the bolts along as the move you onto the arete. Follow cool featured holds to the top. If this was longer and cleaner it would probably gain a star or two.
content.location: To the right of Nuts To You (5.10) on the Northface of Squirrels Nest

climbs.name: Our Boys Are Swimmers
climbs.fa: Terry Kieck and Dave Reich 1991 Ground Up

content.description: To the right of Turkey Baster (5.10+) Follow up the dyke that runs up most of the wall.
content.location: Southface or Squirrels Nest or to the right of Turkey Baster (5.10+)

climbs.name: Nuts To You
climbs.fa: Vernon Phinney and Dennis Laughlin 1986 Ground Up

content.description: Climb up and clip the single bolt. Continue up into the dirty mossed over water groove system. You could place some small gear about midway up. Finish this route out the flake on top.
content.location: Northface( Side that faces Bull Rock)  of Squirrels Nest

content.description: Directly behind Bull Rock is the next formation(s) known as Squirrels Nest. Often overlooked and the climbing could be taller and cleaner. If you like short harder routes this is a good place to come and either TR or lead on shorter mid grade routes.  The corridor that has the sport routes is also known as, Squirrel Alley.  Usually in the shade and you will likely have it to yourself.
